Description: Lip, wall, foot and handle sherd (mended from numerous fragments) of East Greek pottery bowl (rosette bowl?); fine orange clay with much silver mica; interior: dark brown slip, three painted sets of white-red-white stripes; exterior: two sets of verticals on either side of handle; two painted bands below; outer face of handle and of foot painted black; the rest of the outside and the underside reserved.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.288)
